title: User consulting in three forms of network-based organization
proctitle: CHI '81: Proceedings of the Joint Conference on Easier and More Productive Use of Computer Systems. (Part - II): Human Interface and the User Interface - Volume 1981
abstract: The utility of computer networking to organizal tasks is discussed. Three forms of network organization are described, and some examples given. Problems of user consulting in each form of organization are discussed.

references.text: Roistacher, R.C. The network-based scientific community: Economic climate and social structure. IASSIST newsletter. 1978, 2 (1):19-22.

Roistacher, R.C. Three patterns of data and technical information flow in network-based computing communities. Pp. 126-127 in J. P. Cheylan (Ed.) L'impact de l'informatique surles recherches en sciences sociales: Banques de donees et developpements technologiques. Grenoble, France: Institute d'etudes politiques, Universite des Sciences Sociales, 1981.
Roistacher, R.C. and B. B. Noble A network-based research support facility and data archive. Proceedings of the Association for Computing Machinery, 1976, 473-477. (With Barbara B. Noble)

Roistacher, R.C. Research and evaluation of Project New Pride: Cooperation through computer networking. Pp. 145-150 in Proceedings of the 20th Annual Technical Symposium of the Washington, DC chapter of the ACM. Washington, DC: Author, 1981.
